title: Mexico is Transforming for the Good | Dissident VoiceDissident Voice
snippet: Despite predictions that her gender and background would be detrimental, she and Morena candidates won the election by an even greater majority. Sheinbaum won 61% of the popular vote compared to 28% and 11% for the next competitors. Morena now has a supermajority in the Congress and Senate.

title: Marcelo Ebrard - Wikipedia
snippet: In June 2023, Ebrard resigned from his position as secretary of foreign affairs to run for President in the 2024 election, but lost Morena's nomination to Claudia Sheinbaum. On 20 June 2024, President-elect Sheinbaum announced that Ebrard would serve as secretary of economy in her cabinet beginning 1 October 2024. A descendant of the French emigrant wave from Barcelonnette in 1915, Ebrard is the son of architect Marcelo Ebrard Maure and Marcela Casaubón.

title: Ebrard announces possible split with Mexico’s ruling Morena party | Courthouse News Service
snippet: He came in second with 25.8% of the votes. Conducted in 12,500 homes across the country, the poll was designed to be free of manipulation, according to Morena party leader Mario Delgado.

title: Marcelo Ebrard Issues Ultimatum
snippet: Ebrard has requested the annulment of MORENA's presidential candidate election process due to several irregularities in the process.

title: Cabinet Profile: Marcelo Ebrard, Secretary of the Economy | Mexico News Report
snippet: Ebrard ran again for president, this time as part of the MORENA party, but was defeated in the party by Claudia Sheinbaum. But all was not lost for Marcelo.
